review: Meh. You need an Amazon Prime membership for this. All the other stuff you would also need to be a subscriber to use as well. My main issue is with the remote. Pressing left or right either way doesn't do anything at all, or, flies 30 "clicks" in either direction. Pain in the butt when you're trying to zero in on something I want to watch. Great for $19 (launch promotion).
author: Massimo

review: I love it. It was so easy to install, less than 5 minutes. It is amazing how much Amazon has in its library. I wish I had purchased this sooner. The remote is tiny and for someone with a larger hand, it could be a problem. But the on screen graphics are good, but the intro video is pretty lame and could be updated. Otherwise, for $39.00 dollars, very well worth it.
author: Susan Crawford

review: When it worked I really enjoyed it. The UI is nice and easy to use and navigate.With the first one I had, about every 6 hours it would lose connection to the internet and the only fix was to unplug and plug back in the power. I had that one replaced and after a huge mess of confusion in trying to get a replacement since it was out of stock, I finally received that replacement 3 months later. This second one is even worse. It loses connection to the internet about every 15-20 minutes. I give up.For anyone who is interested, this is my setup:Connected to TV using the HDMI extension cable. Using a Linksys Wireless-N Home Router (WRT120N) with the basic quick setup. The TV and router are about 20 ft. apart with one wall in between (wii and xbox have no internet problems)
